intro: Phacelia monoensis, commonly known as the Mono Lake phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, specifically found in the Mono Lake area of California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils along the shores of Mono Lake, where it thrives in the unique alkaline environment. Phacelia monoensis is an annual herb that plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators. Its limited distribution makes it a rare and ecologically significant species in the region.
